      • getTop5

        public java.lang.String[][] getTop5(int level)
                             throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Returns a list of the top five results at a specific level
        Parameters:
        level - 1 for greenhorn, 2 for normal, 3 for master
        Returns:
        a matrix containg the five fastest times and the names
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • getFile

        protected java.io.File getFile(int level)
        Parameters:
        level - 1, 2, 3 for greenhorn, normal or master
        Returns:

      • writeIntoFile

        public void writeIntoFile(java.lang.String name,
                 int time,
                 int level)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the result into a txt-file depending on which level the game is played on
        Parameters:
        name - name of the person
        time - the time that the player got
        level - 1,2 or 3 depending on how large the gameboard was
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getHighscorelist

        public java.lang.String[][] getHighscorelist(java.io.File file)
                                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Will give back a highscore list for the specific level as a matrix
        Parameters:
        file - the file that the result is taken from
        Returns:
        a string matrix containg the name and the time in one row
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
